comments.body: ideally should have these based on version (iow new resample syntax)

yes, I am not sure yet how to approach this. Because we also want that the tests (generally) keep running on older versions to see the evolution over time (at least for some time). So I would personally not yet change it now.

So either we change the benchmarks only when we actually remove the old syntax, or we could define some wrapper method specifically here in the bench file that calls the correct thing

```
def resample_mean(df, ...):
    if pd.__version__ < ..:
        df.resample('', how='mean')
    else:
        df.resample().mean()
```

But that is also a bit unwieldy

We could of course add benchmarks with the new syntax for things that were not possible before with the old syntax.
yeah, or could just put a catchwarnings wrapper around it (and a TODO) for now.
